info.description:
# TERMS AND CONDITIONS
The Powerbot Trading REST API provide B2B services for trading with the EPEX intraday market. By using the Powerbot Trading REST API , each user agrees to the terms and conditions of this licence:
1. The user will comply with the [EPEX Spot Market Rules](https://www.epexspot.com/en/extras/download-center/documentation) and will not endanger the EPEX system (M7) at any time with heavy load from trading algorithms.
2. The user is aware of the OTR limits by EPEX

# INTRODUCTION
The Powerbot-Trading Api is a web-based software service enabling algorithmic trading on power exchanges such as EPEX, HUPX or BSP Southpool. 
The service is straightforward to integrate in an existing software environment and provides a variety of programming interfaces for development of 
individual trading algorithms and software tools. Besides enabling a fully automated intraday trading strategy, 
PowerBot can be used to create support tools for traders providing relevant information and trading opportunities.

For further details see http://powerbot-trading.com

In addition to this API guide, there is a [playground](https://playground.powerbot-trading.com) where you can try out the API calls directly from your web browser. 
In order to access the playground, you will need an API key which you can request from Inercomp. Please contact us at helmut.spindler@inercomp.com   
## Endpoints
The Powerbot Trading REST API is available at the following REST endpoints:

| Instance                | Base URL for REST Endpoints                     |
|-------------------------|-------------------------------------------------|
| Test                    | https://playground.powerbot-trading.com/api/v0  |
| Staging, Production     | Provided on request                     |

Access to endpoints is secured via an API Key, which needs to be passed as an  "api_key" header in each request.
  
 Notes on API Keys:
 * API keys are specific to Test, Staging or Production.
 * An API key is associated with a user account and needs to requested. Please contact us by email at helmut.spindler@inercomp.com to request an API key.

## Errors
The API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate the success or failure of the API call. The body of the response will be in JSON format as follows:

```
{
  "message": "... an error message ..."
}
```

## Paging
The API uses offset and limit parameters for paged operations. An X-Total-Count header is added to responses to indicate the total number of items in a paged response. 
  
## Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
This API features Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) implemented in compliance with  [W3C spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/).
This allows cross-domain communication from the browser.
All responses have a wildcard same-origin which makes them completely public and accessible to everyone, including any code on any site.

## Additional code samples
Additional information and code samples demonstrating the use of the API can be found at https://github.com/powerbot-trading/python-samples.
info.title: Powerbot-Trading Api

post.description:
Use this method to generate a new api_key for your trading algorithm, signal import, etc. 
Requires that you are authenticated with your master api_key which you'll get once your private 
Powerbot trading access has been configured.

name.description: A name for the API key, i.e. "TRADING_API_KEY"

epex_password.description: Your EPEX password which you have received from the POWERSPOT market operation team.

can_trade.description: Set to true, if the api_key should be able to trade.

can_signal.description: Set to true, if the api_key should be allowed to submit signals

get.description: Retrieves log entries which you have submitted earlier with 'addLogEntry'

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset when loading a list of items

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of loaded items

parameters.name: received_from
parameters.description: from timestamp is 'inclusive' (i.e. >=), use UTC time zone

parameters.name: received_to
parameters.description: to timestamp is 'exclusive' (i.e. <), use UTC time zone

id.description: The unique id of the log entry

received.description: The timestamp when the powerbot trading API has received the log entry. UTC timezone is used.

text.description: The content of your log entry

as_of.description: Should be set to the time (UTC) when the log entry was emitted by your system

category.description: An optional category of the log entry

severity.description: The severity of the log entry

post.description:
The Powerbot Trading api helps you to record what your algorithm is doing. You can use this method to log the activity of your trading algorithm. These logs can be retrieved later
by you or displayed by the Powerbot GUI.

id.description: The unique id of the log entry

received.description: The timestamp when the powerbot trading API has received the log entry. UTC timezone is used.

text.description: The content of your log entry

as_of.description: Should be set to the time (UTC) when the log entry was emitted by your system

category.description: An optional category of the log entry

severity.description: The severity of the log entry

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the system which emits signals

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique key of the signal, i.e. the timstamp at which the signal was emitted.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
Signal payload. Will accept any valid json. Set the "delivery_start" and the "delivery_end" attributes to a valid delivery period for a contract of an order book, 
and the order book will return you your previously submitted signals. This is then typically used by trading algorithms to determine if, for instance, a position should
be closed. You can either submit these attributes as part of signal, or as query parameters.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset when loading a list of items

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of loaded items

parameters.name: received_from
parameters.description: from timestamp is 'inclusive' (i.e. >=), use UTC timezones

parameters.name: received_to
parameters.description: to timestamp is 'exclusive' (i.e. <), use UTC timezones

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

received_at.description: The timestamp when the signal was received by PowerBot

revision.description: The number of times the signal has been updated. If the signal has never received any updates, then revision is 0.

delivery_start.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

delivery_end.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Signals payload

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

delivery_start.description: delivery_start together with delivery_end define the contract for which the signal is valid for.

delivery_end.description: delivery_start together with delivery_end define the contract for which the signal is valid for.

schema.description: For each submitted signal a response will be generated

get.summary: List of the trades that you have carried out

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset when loading a list of items

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of loaded items

parameters.name: ordId
parameters.description: Limit the trades to those which are related to a particular order

parameters.name: active_only
parameters.description: Show only those trades which are active (i.e. active or rejected recalls/cancellations)

parameters.name: clOrdrId
parameters.description:
Show only those trades related to orders with a specific 'client order id' (something like 'your reference' which you can submit)
together with an order

parameters.name: txt
parameters.description:
Show only those trades related to orders with a specific 'custom text'. Similar to the clOrdrId, you can
submit a string inside the 'txt' attribute of an order which helps you to identify trades originating from a 
specific order at a later point

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Show only those trades related to a specific contract

parameters.name: from_api_timestamp
parameters.description: from timestamp is 'inclusive' (i.e. >=)

parameters.name: to_api_timestamp
parameters.description: to timestamp is 'exclusive' (i.e. <)

state.description:
* CNCL: Trade was cancelled by market operations.
* RREJ: Requested Recall was rejected by market operations.
* RGRA: Requested Recall was granted by market operations.
* RREQ: Recall of this trade was requested.
* ACTI: Trade is active (this is the default value).
* CREQ: cancel was requested from local market operations. 
* CREJ: cancel was rejected by global market operations.
* RSFA: Request sent for approval to SOB (XBID).

delivery_area.description: If you sold energy with this trade, delivery_area will contain the sell_delivery_area, otherwise the buy_delivery_area

api_timestamp.description: The timestamp when powerbot received the trade (UTC time zone)

exec_time.description: The timestamp when the trade was executed (UTC time zone)

buy_order_id.description: the order_id of the underlying buy-order

buy_delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the buy-side of the trade.

buy_clOrderId.description: the client order id of the buy order

buy_txt.description: the custom text of the buy order

buy_aggressor_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator
* U - Unknown, for executed orders of remote products and data before migration

sell_delivery_area.description: delivery area of the sell order

sell_aggressor_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator
* U - Unknown, for executed orders of remote products and data before migration

contract_id.description: The contract_id against which the trade was executed

contract_name.description: The contract's name against which the trade was executed.

delivery_start.description: Time when the delivery of this trade starts (UTC timezone)

delivery_end.description: Time when the delivery of this trade ends (UTC timezone)

quantity.description: Quantity in MW of the trade

trade_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

contract_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

delete.description:
Attempts to recall a trade. Note that this may fail depending on the conditions set by Market operations. Check the trade's state after
attempting to recall a trade.

parameters.name: trade_id
parameters.description: The unique trade_id

200.description: Success, returns the list of affected trades

state.description:
* CNCL: Trade was cancelled by market operations.
* RREJ: Requested Recall was rejected by market operations.
* RGRA: Requested Recall was granted by market operations.
* RREQ: Recall of this trade was requested.
* ACTI: Trade is active (this is the default value).
* CREQ: cancel was requested from local market operations. 
* CREJ: cancel was rejected by global market operations.
* RSFA: Request sent for approval to SOB (XBID).

exec_time.description: The timestamp when the trade was executed (UTC time zone)

buy_order_id.description: the order_id of the underlying buy-order

buy_delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the buy-side of the trade.

buy_clOrderId.description: the client order id of the buy order

buy_txt.description: the custom text of the buy order

buy_aggressor_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator
* U - Unknown, for executed orders of remote products and data before migration

sell_aggressor_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator
* U - Unknown, for executed orders of remote products and data before migration

contract_id.description: The contract_id against which the trade was executed

contract_name.description: The contract's name against which the trade was executed.

delivery_start.description: Time when the delivery of this trade starts (UTC timezone)

delivery_end.description: Time when the delivery of this trade ends (UTC timezone)

quantity.description: Quantity in MW of the trade

trade_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

contract_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset when loading a list of items

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of loaded items

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: Show only those orders related to a specific contract

parameters.name: active_only
parameters.description: Returns only those orders which are active

order_id.description: the unique id of the order. **Note** if you modify an order, the id will change!

api_timestamp.description: the time (UTC) when Powerbot received the last update of the order

state.description:
The current state of the order in the system. 
* HIBE: The order is entered into the backend system but not exposed to the market.
* ACTI: The order is entered and immediately exposed to the market for execution.
* IACT: The order is deleted.

delivery_area.description: Defines the delivery area of the order.

buy.description: Set to true if the order is a BUY order, false otherwise

sell.description: set to true if the order is a SELL order, false otherwise

contract_id.description: The contract_id of the order's underlying contract

contract_name.description: The contract name of the order's underlying contract

delivery_start.description: the delivery start of the underlying contract.

delivery_end.description: the delivery end of the underlying contract.

clOrdrId.description: The client's order number (if set during the placement of the order)

txt.description: The client's custom text (if set during the placement of the order)

price.description: The price of the order in the contract's currency (usually EUR)

quantity.description: The quantity of the order (in the contract's quantity unit - usually MW)

action.description:
The action which has been carried out for the order
* UADD: Order added by user.
* UHIB: Order deactivated by user.
* UMOD: Order modified by user.
* UDEL: Order deleted by user.
* UREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by user.
* AADD: Order added by market operations on behalf.
* AHIB: Order deactivated by market operations on behalf. AMOD: Order modified by market operations on behalf.
* ADEL: Order deleted by market operations on behalf.
* AREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by market operations on behalf.
* SADD: Order added by the system.
* SHIB: Order deactivated by the system. SMOD: Order modified by the system. SDEL: Order deleted by the system.
* SREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by system.
* FEXE: Order is fully executed.
* PEXE: Partial execution of order.
* IADD: A new slice of an Iceberg order was added to the service.
* QADD: Quote was added
* QFEX: Quote was fully executed

details.description: All details of the order (as received from the underlying backend system)

post.description: Allows you to place a new sell or bid order.

delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the orderbook's product. Mandatory in a multi-delivery-area configuration

quantity.description: The quantity of the order in MW.

price.description: The price of ther order in the traded currency (usually EUR)

displayQty.description: Used to define display quantity of an Iceberg Order. This field is required only in the case of type=I.

contractId.description: The contractId of the order, can be omitted if contractName is specified instead.

contractName.description: Set a contract name instead of the contractId, and the attempt is made to look up the contract via it's name. If contractId is set, the contractName field is ignored.

clOrdrId.description: the "client order id" which can be used to identify the order at a later point (i.e. within a trade)

clearingAcctType.description:
Defines if the order is entered on own account or as an agent. 
For the set of valid values please refer to values from attribute allowedClearingAcctTypes in SystemInfoResp message (e.g. A,P for spot markets)

ordrExeRestriction.description:
Execution restriction of the order.

* NON: No restriction. This is the default.
* FOK: (Fill or Kill) - The order is immediately fully executed or deleted.
* IOC: (Immediate and cancel): The order is executed immediately to its maximum extent. In case of a partial execution, the remaining volume is removed from the order book.
* AON: (All or None): The order must be filled completely or not at all. The order stays in the order book until it is executed or removed by the system or user. 
* AU (Auction): The order was entered in auction phase (no restriction is applied)

preArranged.description: Flag which indicates if the entered order is a pre-arranged order or not.

preArrangedAcct.description: Required in case of a pre-arranged order. Contains the account of the counterpart.

type.description:
* O: Regular limit order.
* B: User defined block order.
* I: Iceberg order.
* L: Balance order.
* C: Indicative order.
* S: Stop limit order.
* E: On exchange prearranged trade
* N: Private and confidential trade
* H: Lifting order for products with Hit & Lift matcher 
* Q: quote order
* W: Indicative quote order

validityRes.description:
Validity restriction of the order. 
* GFS (Good for trading session): The order rests in the order book until it is either executed, removed by the user or the current trading session (trading phase) of the underlying contract ends.
* GTD (Good till date, will be introduced with CX 3.5): The order rests in the order book until the date specified in the validityDate field.
* NON (No validity restriction): Mandatory for orders with the execution restriction FOK or IOC.

state.description:
* ACTI: The order is entered and immediately exposed to the market for execution. This is the default value.
* HIBE: The order is entered into the backend system but not exposed to the market.

validityDate.description:
mandatory in case of validityRes equals GTD. It is used to define the date until which the order is valid. 
The remaining part of the order will be removed from the order book after this point in time.

txt.description: Text which can be retrieved at a later point (i.e. via a trade which was triggered by the order)

ppd.description:
Peak price delta for Iceberg orders.
* The ppd of buy orders must be smaller or equal than zero.
* The ppd of sell orders must be greater or equal than zero.
If it is omitted the system will assume a value of 0,00.

dlvryStart.description: (optional) Start of delivery of the underlying contract.

dlvryEnd.description: (optional) End of delivery of the underlying contract.

order_id.description: the unique id of the order. **Note** if you modify an order, the id will change!

api_timestamp.description: the time (UTC) when Powerbot received the last update of the order

state.description:
The current state of the order in the system. 
* HIBE: The order is entered into the backend system but not exposed to the market.
* ACTI: The order is entered and immediately exposed to the market for execution.
* IACT: The order is deleted.

delivery_area.description: Defines the delivery area of the order.

buy.description: Set to true if the order is a BUY order, false otherwise

sell.description: set to true if the order is a SELL order, false otherwise

contract_id.description: The contract_id of the order's underlying contract

contract_name.description: The contract name of the order's underlying contract

delivery_start.description: the delivery start of the underlying contract.

delivery_end.description: the delivery end of the underlying contract.

clOrdrId.description: The client's order number (if set during the placement of the order)

txt.description: The client's custom text (if set during the placement of the order)

price.description: The price of the order in the contract's currency (usually EUR)

quantity.description: The quantity of the order (in the contract's quantity unit - usually MW)

action.description:
The action which has been carried out for the order
* UADD: Order added by user.
* UHIB: Order deactivated by user.
* UMOD: Order modified by user.
* UDEL: Order deleted by user.
* UREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by user.
* AADD: Order added by market operations on behalf.
* AHIB: Order deactivated by market operations on behalf. AMOD: Order modified by market operations on behalf.
* ADEL: Order deleted by market operations on behalf.
* AREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by market operations on behalf.
* SADD: Order added by the system.
* SHIB: Order deactivated by the system. SMOD: Order modified by the system. SDEL: Order deleted by the system.
* SREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by system.
* FEXE: Order is fully executed.
* PEXE: Partial execution of order.
* IADD: A new slice of an Iceberg order was added to the service.
* QADD: Quote was added
* QFEX: Quote was fully executed

details.description: All details of the order (as received from the underlying backend system)

post.summary: Place a list of new orders
post.description: Allows you to place a new sell or bid orders. For each requested order one response is generated. In case of sucess, the order is returned otherwise an error message is returned.

parameters.name: exec_instruction
parameters.description:
Defines the execution instruction for the whole list of orders: 
  * **VALID**: default. All orders must be valid, meaning they must past the order validation of the backend system (e.g. the price of the order must be in the price range of the product). If one order does not pass the validation, the full list of submitted orders is rejected.
  * **LNKD**: Linked orders - the provided orders are linked together and should be executed all at once. This option can only be used, if all orders have the same product and the execution restriction FOK (Fill-or-Kill). In case one of the orders cannot be executed, the whole list is not executed. The Linked Orders feature is configurable and might be turned off by EPEX.

delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the orderbook's product. Mandatory in a multi-delivery-area configuration

quantity.description: The quantity of the order in MW.

price.description: The price of ther order in the traded currency (usually EUR)

displayQty.description: Used to define display quantity of an Iceberg Order. This field is required only in the case of type=I.

contractId.description: The contractId of the order, can be omitted if contractName is specified instead.

contractName.description: Set a contract name instead of the contractId, and the attempt is made to look up the contract via it's name. If contractId is set, the contractName field is ignored.

clOrdrId.description: the "client order id" which can be used to identify the order at a later point (i.e. within a trade)

clearingAcctType.description:
Defines if the order is entered on own account or as an agent. 
For the set of valid values please refer to values from attribute allowedClearingAcctTypes in SystemInfoResp message (e.g. A,P for spot markets)

* FOK: (Fill or Kill) - The order is immediately fully executed or deleted.
* IOC: (Immediate and cancel): The order is executed immediately to its maximum extent. In case of a partial execution, the remaining volume is removed from the order book.
* AON: (All or None): The order must be filled completely or not at all. The order stays in the order book until it is executed or removed by the system or user. 
* AU (Auction): The order was entered in auction phase (no restriction is applied)

preArrangedAcct.description: Required in case of a pre-arranged order. Contains the account of the counterpart.

* O: Regular limit order.
* B: User defined block order.
* I: Iceberg order.
* L: Balance order.
* C: Indicative order.
* S: Stop limit order.
* E: On exchange prearranged trade
* N: Private and confidential trade
* H: Lifting order for products with Hit & Lift matcher 
* Q: quote order
* W: Indicative quote order

validityRes.description:
Validity restriction of the order. 
* GFS (Good for trading session): The order rests in the order book until it is either executed, removed by the user or the current trading session (trading phase) of the underlying contract ends.
* GTD (Good till date, will be introduced with CX 3.5): The order rests in the order book until the date specified in the validityDate field.
* NON (No validity restriction): Mandatory for orders with the execution restriction FOK or IOC.

* ACTI: The order is entered and immediately exposed to the market for execution. This is the default value.

The remaining part of the order will be removed from the order book after this point in time.

* The ppd of buy orders must be smaller or equal than zero.
* The ppd of sell orders must be greater or equal than zero.
If it is omitted the system will assume a value of 0,00.

dlvryStart.description: (optional) Start of delivery of the underlying contract.

dlvryEnd.description: (optional) End of delivery of the underlying contract.

order_id.description: the unique id of the order. **Note** if you modify an order, the id will change!

api_timestamp.description: the time (UTC) when Powerbot received the last update of the order

state.description:
The current state of the order in the system. 
* HIBE: The order is entered into the backend system but not exposed to the market.
* ACTI: The order is entered and immediately exposed to the market for execution.
* IACT: The order is deleted.

delivery_area.description: Defines the delivery area of the order.

buy.description: Set to true if the order is a BUY order, false otherwise

sell.description: set to true if the order is a SELL order, false otherwise

contract_id.description: The contract_id of the order's underlying contract

contract_name.description: The contract name of the order's underlying contract

delivery_start.description: the delivery start of the underlying contract.

delivery_end.description: the delivery end of the underlying contract.

clOrdrId.description: The client's order number (if set during the placement of the order)

txt.description: The client's custom text (if set during the placement of the order)

price.description: The price of the order in the contract's currency (usually EUR)

quantity.description: The quantity of the order (in the contract's quantity unit - usually MW)

action.description:
The action which has been carried out for the order
* UADD: Order added by user.
* UHIB: Order deactivated by user.
* UMOD: Order modified by user.
* UDEL: Order deleted by user.
* UREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by user.
* AADD: Order added by market operations on behalf.
* AHIB: Order deactivated by market operations on behalf. AMOD: Order modified by market operations on behalf.
* ADEL: Order deleted by market operations on behalf.
* AREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by market operations on behalf.
* SADD: Order added by the system.
* SHIB: Order deactivated by the system. SMOD: Order modified by the system. SDEL: Order deleted by the system.
* SREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by system.
* FEXE: Order is fully executed.
* PEXE: Partial execution of order.
* IADD: A new slice of an Iceberg order was added to the service.
* QADD: Quote was added
* QFEX: Quote was fully executed

details.description: All details of the order (as received from the underlying backend system)

put.summary: Updates the status of all own orders at once

orderModType.description:
* ACTI: Activates the order. Ignored if already active.
* DEAC: Deactivates (hibernates) the order. Hibernated orders are removed from the order book but are still available for modification or activation in the own orders list.
* DELE: Delete the order

prodName.description: Restrict the request to the given product(s)

get.summary: Retrieves the history of the contract

parameters.name: contract_id
parameters.description: The unique id of the contract

parameters.name: from_revision
parameters.description: Revisions start with 0, each change increments it by 1

as_of.description: The timestamp as of the entry is valid

revisionNo.description: The running revision number of the entry

vwap.description: The volume weighted average price at that time

best_bid_price.description: The best bid's price at that time

best_bid_quantity.description: The best bid's quantity at that time

best_ask_price.description: The best ask's price at that time

best_ask_quantity.description: The best asks's quantity at that time

last_price.description: The price of the last trade at that time

last_quantity.description: The quantity of the last trade at that time

total_quantity.description: The total volume of the contract ot that time

high.description: Highest traded price since the start of the trading period at the current point in time.

low.description: Lowest traded price since the start of the trading period at the current point in time.

signals.description: Signals valid as of the current point in time.

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

received_at.description: The timestamp when the signal was received by PowerBot

revision.description: The number of times the signal has been updated. If the signal has never received any updates, then revision is 0.

delivery_start.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

delivery_end.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

trades.description: Lists the trades which occurred since the previous point in time.

state.description:
* CNCL: Trade was cancelled by market operations.
* RREJ: Requested Recall was rejected by market operations.
* RGRA: Requested Recall was granted by market operations.
* RREQ: Recall of this trade was requested.
* ACTI: Trade is active (this is the default value).
* CREQ: cancel was requested from local market operations. 
* CREJ: cancel was rejected by global market operations.
* RSFA: Request sent for approval to SOB (XBID).

delivery_area.description: If you sold energy with this trade, delivery_area will contain the sell_delivery_area, otherwise the buy_delivery_area

api_timestamp.description: The timestamp when powerbot received the trade (UTC time zone)

exec_time.description: The timestamp when the trade was executed (UTC time zone)

buy_order_id.description: the order_id of the underlying buy-order

buy_delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the buy-side of the trade.

buy_clOrderId.description: the client order id of the buy order

buy_txt.description: the custom text of the buy order

buy_aggressor_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator
* U - Unknown, for executed orders of remote products and data before migration

sell_delivery_area.description: delivery area of the sell order

sell_aggressor_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator
* U - Unknown, for executed orders of remote products and data before migration

contract_id.description: The contract_id against which the trade was executed

contract_name.description: The contract's name against which the trade was executed.

delivery_start.description: Time when the delivery of this trade starts (UTC timezone)

delivery_end.description: Time when the delivery of this trade ends (UTC timezone)

quantity.description: Quantity in MW of the trade

trade_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

contract_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

get.summary: Retrieves the public trades for the contract

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset when loading a list of items

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of loaded items

parameters.name: from_api_timestamp
parameters.description: from timestamp is 'inclusive' (i.e. >=)

parameters.name: to_api_timestamp
parameters.description: to timestamp is 'exclusive' (i.e. <)

trade_id.description: the uniqe id of the public trade

api_timestamp.description: The timestamp (UTC) when Powerbot has received the information of the backend system

exec_time.description: The timestamp (UTC) when the public trade was executed

contract_id.description: The id of the contract on which the public trade was executed

price.description: The price (usually in EUR, but depends on the contract) of the public trade

quantity.description: The quantity (usually in MW, but depends on the contract) of the public trade

get.summary: Retrieves the current bids and asks of the contract

delivery_start.description: The delivery start time (UTC) of the contract

delivery_end.description: The delivery end time (UTC) of the contract

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

received_at.description: The timestamp when the signal was received by PowerBot

revision.description: The number of times the signal has been updated. If the signal has never received any updates, then revision is 0.

delivery_start.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

delivery_end.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

put.description: Changes, activates or deactivates an existing order

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: the unique order_id. **Heads up!** After an order has been modified, it will change its's order_id!

action.description:
* ACTI: Activates the order. Ignored if already active.
* DEAC: Deactivates (hibernates) the order. Hibernated orders are removed from the order book but are still available for modification or activation in the own orders list.
* MODI: Modify the order
* DELE: Delete the order

validityRes.description:
Set this field, if you want to update the validity restriction of the order
* GFS (Good for trading session): The order stays in the order book until it is either executed, removed by the user or the current trading session (trading phase) of the underlying contract ends.
* GTD (Good till date, will be introduced with CX 3.5): The order stays in the order book until the date specified in the validityDate field.
* NON (No validity restriction): Mandatory for orders with the execution restriction FOK or IOC.

validityDate.description:
Set this field, if you want to update the validity date of the order. Only mandatory in case of validityRes equals GTD. It is used to define the date until which the order is valid. 
The remaining part of the order will be removed from the order book after this point in time.

type.description:
Set this field, if you want to update the order's type.
* O: Regular limit order.
* B: User defined block order.
* I: Iceberg order.
* L: Balance order.
* C: Indicative order.
* S: Stop limit order.
* E: On exchange prearranged trade
* N: Private and confidential trade
* H: Lifting order for products with Hit & Lift matcher 
* Q: quote order
* W: Indicative quote order

txt.description: Set this field if you want to update the order's 'custom text'

ordrExeRestriction.description:
Set this field if you want to update the order's execution restriction
* NON: No restriction. This is the default.
* FOK: (Fill or Kill) - The order is immediately fully executed or deleted.
* IOC: (Immediate and cancel): The order is executed immediately to its maximum extend. In case of a partial execution, the remaining volume is removed from the order book.
* AON: (All or None): The order must be filled completely or not at all. The order stays in the order book until it is executed or removed by the system or user. 
* AU (Auction): The order was entered in auction phase (no restriction is applied)

quantity.description: Set this field if you want to update the order's quantity.

displayQty.description: Set this field if you want to update the display quantity of an Iceberg Order. This field is required only in the case of type=I.

price.description: Set this field if you want to update the order's description.

clOrdrId.description: Set this field if you want to update the order's client order id.

ppd.description:
Set this field if you want to update the Peak price delta for Iceberg orders.
* The ppd of buy orders must be smaller or equal than zero.
* The ppd of sell orders must be greater or equal than zero.
If it is omitted the system will assume a value of 0,00.

order_id.description: the unique id of the order. **Note** if you modify an order, the id will change!

api_timestamp.description: the time (UTC) when Powerbot received the last update of the order

state.description:
The current state of the order in the system. 
* HIBE: The order is entered into the backend system but not exposed to the market.
* ACTI: The order is entered and immediately exposed to the market for execution.
* IACT: The order is deleted.

delivery_area.description: Defines the delivery area of the order.

buy.description: Set to true if the order is a BUY order, false otherwise

sell.description: set to true if the order is a SELL order, false otherwise

contract_id.description: The contract_id of the order's underlying contract

contract_name.description: The contract name of the order's underlying contract

delivery_start.description: the delivery start of the underlying contract.

delivery_end.description: the delivery end of the underlying contract.

clOrdrId.description: The client's order number (if set during the placement of the order)

txt.description: The client's custom text (if set during the placement of the order)

price.description: The price of the order in the contract's currency (usually EUR)

quantity.description: The quantity of the order (in the contract's quantity unit - usually MW)

action.description:
The action which has been carried out for the order
* UADD: Order added by user.
* UHIB: Order deactivated by user.
* UMOD: Order modified by user.
* UDEL: Order deleted by user.
* UREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by user.
* AADD: Order added by market operations on behalf.
* AHIB: Order deactivated by market operations on behalf. AMOD: Order modified by market operations on behalf.
* ADEL: Order deleted by market operations on behalf.
* AREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by market operations on behalf.
* SADD: Order added by the system.
* SHIB: Order deactivated by the system. SMOD: Order modified by the system. SDEL: Order deleted by the system.
* SREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by system.
* FEXE: Order is fully executed.
* PEXE: Partial execution of order.
* IADD: A new slice of an Iceberg order was added to the service.
* QADD: Quote was added
* QFEX: Quote was fully executed

details.description: All details of the order (as received from the underlying backend system)

get.summary: Retrieves the public order books (sorted by delivery ascending)
get.description: Shows the public order books for the requested products (or all available products)

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The list of products (e.g. Intraday_Power_D or Intraday_Power_D,XBID_Hour_Power) for which the orderbook(s) should be retrieved; leave blank if you want all available orderbooks

parameters.name: with_bid_or_ask_only
parameters.description: If set to true, the returned orderbook will contain only contracts which contain at least one active bid or ask

parameters.name: contractId
parameters.description: limit the orderbook to a certain contract only

parameters.name: contractName
parameters.description: limit the orderbook to a certain contract name only

parameters.name: delivery_start
parameters.description: limit the orderbook to those contracts with the given delivery start date

parameters.name: delivery_end
parameters.description: limit the orderbook to those contracts with the given delivery end date

parameters.name: delivery_within
parameters.description: limit the orderbook to those contracts having a delivery start/end date which starts before and ends after the given parameter

parameters.name: past_hours
parameters.description: The number of hours to look behind in the orderbook. If this parameter is set, also historic closed contacts are contained in the orderbook

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of returned order books

products.description: The involved products of the orderbooks

delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the orderbook's product

price_currency.description: the price currency of the underlying contracts

quantity_unit.description: the quantity unit of the underlying contracts

revision_no.description: A running number starting at 0; Every time the contract changes (i.e. a trade is made), this number increments.

delivery_start.description: The delivery start time (UTC) of the contract

delivery_end.description: The delivery end time (UTC) of the contract

best_bid_price.description: The best bid's price in the orderbook's currency (i.e. EUR)

best_bid_quantity.description: The best bid's quantity in the orderbook's quantity unit (i.e. MW)

best_ask_price.description: The best asks's price in the orderbook's currency (i.e. EUR)

best_ask_quantity.description: The best asks's quantity in the orderbook's quantity unit (i.e. MW)

last_price.description: The price of the last trade (in the orderbook's currency)

last_quantity.description: The quantity of the last trade (in the orderbook's quantity unit)

total_quantity.description: The total volume of all trades (in the orderbook's quantity unit)

high.description: Highest traded price since the start of the trading period.

low.description: Lowest traded price since the start of the trading period

contract_details.description: All contract details (as delivered from the backend system)

orderbook_details.description: All orderbook details (as delivered from the backend system)

relative_position.description: Your relative position in the contract

absolute_position.description: Your absolute position in the contract

signals.description: The signals applicable for the contract

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

received_at.description: The timestamp when the signal was received by PowerBot

revision.description: The number of times the signal has been updated. If the signal has never received any updates, then revision is 0.

delivery_start.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

delivery_end.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

get.summary: Retrieves the status of the market

api_timestamp.description: The timestamp when the status of the market was last checked.

status.description:
The current state of the market
* OK Everyhting's ok, trading is possible
* WARNING Trading might not be possible, check the messages.
* FAILURE Trading is not possible right now.

relative_position_limit.description: Releative position limt (per contract)  in MW

absolute_position_limit.description: Absolute position limt (per contract)  in MW

urls.description: The urls of EPEX's backand system Powerbot is connected to

products.description: EPEX products which powerbot is linked with

market_area_id.description: The market powerbot is configured to operate in

delivery_area_id.description: The delivery areay powerbot is configured to operate in

logged_in_since.description: The timstamp (UTC) since when Powerbot has logged-into the backend system

heartbeat_as_of.description: The timestamp when the last heartbeat of the backend system has been received (should be not older than 5 seconds)

heartbeat_content.description: The content of the last heartbeat

messages.description: Messages explaining the state of the market

state.description:
The current state of the order in the system. 
* HIBE: The order is entered into the backend system but not exposed to the market.
* ACTI: The order is entered and immediately exposed to the market for execution.
* IACT: The order is deleted.

delivery_area.description: Defines the delivery area of the order.

buy.description: Set to true if the order is a BUY order, false otherwise

sell.description: set to true if the order is a SELL order, false otherwise

contract_name.description: The contract name of the order's underlying contract

delivery_end.description: the delivery end of the underlying contract.

price.description: The price of the order in the contract's currency (usually EUR)

quantity.description: The quantity of the order (in the contract's quantity unit - usually MW)

action.description:
The action which has been carried out for the order
* UADD: Order added by user.
* UHIB: Order deactivated by user.
* UMOD: Order modified by user.
* UDEL: Order deleted by user.
* UREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by user.
* AADD: Order added by market operations on behalf.
* AHIB: Order deactivated by market operations on behalf. AMOD: Order modified by market operations on behalf.
* ADEL: Order deleted by market operations on behalf.
* AREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by market operations on behalf.
* SADD: Order added by the system.
* SHIB: Order deactivated by the system. SMOD: Order modified by the system. SDEL: Order deleted by the system.
* SREJ: Pre-arranged order rejected by system.
* FEXE: Order is fully executed.
* PEXE: Partial execution of order.
* IADD: A new slice of an Iceberg order was added to the service.
* QADD: Quote was added
* QFEX: Quote was fully executed

quantity.description: The quantity (usually in MW, but depends on the contract) of the public trade

state.description:
* CNCL: Trade was cancelled by market operations.
* RREJ: Requested Recall was rejected by market operations.
* RGRA: Requested Recall was granted by market operations.
* RREQ: Recall of this trade was requested.
* ACTI: Trade is active (this is the default value).
* CREQ: cancel was requested from local market operations. 
* CREJ: cancel was rejected by global market operations.
* RSFA: Request sent for approval to SOB (XBID).

delivery_area.description: If you sold energy with this trade, delivery_area will contain the sell_delivery_area, otherwise the buy_delivery_area

api_timestamp.description: The timestamp when powerbot received the trade (UTC time zone)

exec_time.description: The timestamp when the trade was executed (UTC time zone)

buy_order_id.description: the order_id of the underlying buy-order

buy_delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the buy-side of the trade.

buy_clOrderId.description: the client order id of the buy order

buy_txt.description: the custom text of the buy order

buy_aggressor_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator
* U - Unknown, for executed orders of remote products and data before migration

sell_delivery_area.description: delivery area of the sell order

sell_aggressor_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator
* U - Unknown, for executed orders of remote products and data before migration

contract_id.description: The contract_id against which the trade was executed

contract_name.description: The contract's name against which the trade was executed.

delivery_start.description: Time when the delivery of this trade starts (UTC timezone)

delivery_end.description: Time when the delivery of this trade ends (UTC timezone)

quantity.description: Quantity in MW of the trade

trade_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

contract_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

as_of.description: The timestamp as of the entry is valid

revisionNo.description: The running revision number of the entry

vwap.description: The volume weighted average price at that time

best_bid_price.description: The best bid's price at that time

best_bid_quantity.description: The best bid's quantity at that time

best_ask_price.description: The best ask's price at that time

best_ask_quantity.description: The best asks's quantity at that time

last_price.description: The price of the last trade at that time

last_quantity.description: The quantity of the last trade at that time

total_quantity.description: The total volume of the contract ot that time

high.description: Highest traded price since the start of the trading period at the current point in time.

low.description: Lowest traded price since the start of the trading period at the current point in time.

signals.description: Signals valid as of the current point in time.

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

received_at.description: The timestamp when the signal was received by PowerBot

revision.description: The number of times the signal has been updated. If the signal has never received any updates, then revision is 0.

delivery_start.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

delivery_end.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

trades.description: Lists the trades which occurred since the previous point in time.

state.description:
* CNCL: Trade was cancelled by market operations.
* RREJ: Requested Recall was rejected by market operations.
* RGRA: Requested Recall was granted by market operations.
* RREQ: Recall of this trade was requested.
* ACTI: Trade is active (this is the default value).
* CREQ: cancel was requested from local market operations. 
* CREJ: cancel was rejected by global market operations.
* RSFA: Request sent for approval to SOB (XBID).

exec_time.description: The timestamp when the trade was executed (UTC time zone)

buy_order_id.description: the order_id of the underlying buy-order

buy_delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the buy-side of the trade.

buy_clOrderId.description: the client order id of the buy order

buy_txt.description: the custom text of the buy order

Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator

Indicates whether the executed order was a trade aggressor or trade originator.  
* Y - Trade aggressor
* N - Trade originator

contract_name.description: The contract's name against which the trade was executed.

delivery_start.description: Time when the delivery of this trade starts (UTC timezone)

delivery_end.description: Time when the delivery of this trade ends (UTC timezone)

trade_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

contract_details.description: Details of the trade provided by EPEX, Please consult the "DFS180 - M7 - Public Message Interface" for details.

delivery_start.description: The delivery start time (UTC) of the contract

delivery_end.description: The delivery end time (UTC) of the contract

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

received_at.description: The timestamp when the signal was received by PowerBot

revision.description: The number of times the signal has been updated. If the signal has never received any updates, then revision is 0.

delivery_start.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

delivery_end.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

revision_no.description: A running number starting at 0; Every time the contract changes (i.e. a trade is made), this number increments.

delivery_start.description: The delivery start time (UTC) of the contract

delivery_end.description: The delivery end time (UTC) of the contract

best_bid_price.description: The best bid's price in the orderbook's currency (i.e. EUR)

best_bid_quantity.description: The best bid's quantity in the orderbook's quantity unit (i.e. MW)

best_ask_price.description: The best asks's price in the orderbook's currency (i.e. EUR)

best_ask_quantity.description: The best asks's quantity in the orderbook's quantity unit (i.e. MW)

last_price.description: The price of the last trade (in the orderbook's currency)

last_quantity.description: The quantity of the last trade (in the orderbook's quantity unit)

total_quantity.description: The total volume of all trades (in the orderbook's quantity unit)

high.description: Highest traded price since the start of the trading period.

low.description: Lowest traded price since the start of the trading period

contract_details.description: All contract details (as delivered from the backend system)

orderbook_details.description: All orderbook details (as delivered from the backend system)

relative_position.description: Your relative position in the contract

absolute_position.description: Your absolute position in the contract

signals.description: The signals applicable for the contract

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

received_at.description: The timestamp when the signal was received by PowerBot

revision.description: The number of times the signal has been updated. If the signal has never received any updates, then revision is 0.

delivery_start.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

delivery_end.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

orderModType.description:
* ACTI: Activates the order. Ignored if already active.
* DEAC: Deactivates (hibernates) the order. Hibernated orders are removed from the order book but are still available for modification or activation in the own orders list.
* DELE: Delete the order

prodName.description: Restrict the request to the given product(s)

action.description:
* ACTI: Activates the order. Ignored if already active.
* DEAC: Deactivates (hibernates) the order. Hibernated orders are removed from the order book but are still available for modification or activation in the own orders list.
* MODI: Modify the order
* DELE: Delete the order

validityRes.description:
Set this field, if you want to update the validity restriction of the order
* GFS (Good for trading session): The order stays in the order book until it is either executed, removed by the user or the current trading session (trading phase) of the underlying contract ends.
* GTD (Good till date, will be introduced with CX 3.5): The order stays in the order book until the date specified in the validityDate field.
* NON (No validity restriction): Mandatory for orders with the execution restriction FOK or IOC.

validityDate.description:
Set this field, if you want to update the validity date of the order. Only mandatory in case of validityRes equals GTD. It is used to define the date until which the order is valid. 
The remaining part of the order will be removed from the order book after this point in time.

type.description:
Set this field, if you want to update the order's type.
* O: Regular limit order.
* B: User defined block order.
* I: Iceberg order.
* L: Balance order.
* C: Indicative order.
* S: Stop limit order.
* E: On exchange prearranged trade
* N: Private and confidential trade
* H: Lifting order for products with Hit & Lift matcher 
* Q: quote order
* W: Indicative quote order

txt.description: Set this field if you want to update the order's 'custom text'

ordrExeRestriction.description:
Set this field if you want to update the order's execution restriction
* NON: No restriction. This is the default.
* FOK: (Fill or Kill) - The order is immediately fully executed or deleted.
* IOC: (Immediate and cancel): The order is executed immediately to its maximum extend. In case of a partial execution, the remaining volume is removed from the order book.
* AON: (All or None): The order must be filled completely or not at all. The order stays in the order book until it is executed or removed by the system or user. 
* AU (Auction): The order was entered in auction phase (no restriction is applied)

quantity.description: Set this field if you want to update the order's quantity.

displayQty.description: Set this field if you want to update the display quantity of an Iceberg Order. This field is required only in the case of type=I.

price.description: Set this field if you want to update the order's description.

clOrdrId.description: Set this field if you want to update the order's client order id.

ppd.description:
Set this field if you want to update the Peak price delta for Iceberg orders.
* The ppd of buy orders must be smaller or equal than zero.
* The ppd of sell orders must be greater or equal than zero.
If it is omitted the system will assume a value of 0,00.

delivery_area.description: The delivery area of the orderbook's product. Mandatory in a multi-delivery-area configuration

quantity.description: The quantity of the order in MW.

price.description: The price of ther order in the traded currency (usually EUR)

displayQty.description: Used to define display quantity of an Iceberg Order. This field is required only in the case of type=I.

contractId.description: The contractId of the order, can be omitted if contractName is specified instead.

contractName.description: Set a contract name instead of the contractId, and the attempt is made to look up the contract via it's name. If contractId is set, the contractName field is ignored.

clOrdrId.description: the "client order id" which can be used to identify the order at a later point (i.e. within a trade)

clearingAcctType.description:
Defines if the order is entered on own account or as an agent. 
For the set of valid values please refer to values from attribute allowedClearingAcctTypes in SystemInfoResp message (e.g. A,P for spot markets)

ordrExeRestriction.description:
Execution restriction of the order.

* NON: No restriction. This is the default.
* FOK: (Fill or Kill) - The order is immediately fully executed or deleted.
* IOC: (Immediate and cancel): The order is executed immediately to its maximum extent. In case of a partial execution, the remaining volume is removed from the order book.
* AON: (All or None): The order must be filled completely or not at all. The order stays in the order book until it is executed or removed by the system or user. 
* AU (Auction): The order was entered in auction phase (no restriction is applied)

preArranged.description: Flag which indicates if the entered order is a pre-arranged order or not.

preArrangedAcct.description: Required in case of a pre-arranged order. Contains the account of the counterpart.

type.description:
* O: Regular limit order.
* B: User defined block order.
* I: Iceberg order.
* L: Balance order.
* C: Indicative order.
* S: Stop limit order.
* E: On exchange prearranged trade
* N: Private and confidential trade
* H: Lifting order for products with Hit & Lift matcher 
* Q: quote order
* W: Indicative quote order

validityRes.description:
Validity restriction of the order. 
* GFS (Good for trading session): The order rests in the order book until it is either executed, removed by the user or the current trading session (trading phase) of the underlying contract ends.
* GTD (Good till date, will be introduced with CX 3.5): The order rests in the order book until the date specified in the validityDate field.
* NON (No validity restriction): Mandatory for orders with the execution restriction FOK or IOC.

state.description:
* ACTI: The order is entered and immediately exposed to the market for execution. This is the default value.
* HIBE: The order is entered into the backend system but not exposed to the market.

validityDate.description:
mandatory in case of validityRes equals GTD. It is used to define the date until which the order is valid. 
The remaining part of the order will be removed from the order book after this point in time.

txt.description: Text which can be retrieved at a later point (i.e. via a trade which was triggered by the order)

ppd.description:
Peak price delta for Iceberg orders.
* The ppd of buy orders must be smaller or equal than zero.
* The ppd of sell orders must be greater or equal than zero.
If it is omitted the system will assume a value of 0,00.

dlvryStart.description: (optional) Start of delivery of the underlying contract.

dlvryEnd.description: (optional) End of delivery of the underlying contract.

relative_position_limit.description: Releative position limt (per contract)  in MW

absolute_position_limit.description: Absolute position limt (per contract)  in MW

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

received_at.description: The timestamp when the signal was received by PowerBot

revision.description: The number of times the signal has been updated. If the signal has never received any updates, then revision is 0.

delivery_start.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

delivery_end.description: Together with delivery_start and delivery_end specify the delivery period in which the signal is valid

id.description: The unique id of the log entry

received.description: The timestamp when the powerbot trading API has received the log entry. UTC timezone is used.

text.description: The content of your log entry

as_of.description: Should be set to the time (UTC) when the log entry was emitted by your system

category.description: An optional category of the log entry

severity.description: The severity of the log entry

name.description: A name for the API key, i.e. "TRADING_API_KEY"

epex_password.description: Your EPEX password which you have received from the POWERSPOT market operation team.

can_trade.description: Set to true, if the api_key should be able to trade.

can_signal.description: Set to true, if the api_key should be allowed to submit signals

id.description: The unique id of the signal (within the namespace of the emitting source)

source.description: The identifier of the system which emitted the signal

delivery_start.description: delivery_start together with delivery_end define the contract for which the signal is valid for.

delivery_end.description: delivery_start together with delivery_end define the contract for which the signal is valid for.
